metadata.title: CVE-2022-0391 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Python, specifically within the urllib.parse module.This module helps break Uniform Resource Locator (URL) strings intocomponents. The issue involves how the urlparse method does not sanitizeinput and allows characters like '\r' and '\n' in the URL path. This flawallows an attacker to input a crafted URL, leading to injection attacks.This flaw affects Python versions prior to 3.10.0b1, 3.9.5, 3.8.11, 3.7.11and 3.6.14.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-examples - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-full - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
python3.8-venv - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.7-1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.7-1
python3.9 - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.7-1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-1~20.04.3+esm1').
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04.4').
python3.9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.7-1').
